channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping around abandoned skip in Linton Close, Welling, 10th October
item.description:
Flytipping around abandoned skip in Linton Close, Welling - caller says they are seeing rats, there are also needles and broken glass, mattresses and other misc items dumped. caller says skip co are refusing to remove skip until this flytipping is cleared
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Caravans being parked in Linton Close, Welling, 10th October
item.description:
Caravans being parked in Linton Close, Welling - lots of males are arriving, elderly people living in the close are feeling threatened....also says the males are smoking substances

item.title: More fly tipping, 10th October
item.description:
Thanks for cleaning up the mess from the other week, today new litter was dumbed, as pretty much every week. This time someone forgot to remove their address from the parcel that was dumbed. As the first trash dumbed usually leads to more, I reported it

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shepherdess Walk, Hackney, London

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 10th October
item.description:
This vehicle is collecting parking tickets and has been on the yellow lines for 5 days no one/no neighbours knows who it belongs to. This car is outside number 42 & 44 Kimberley drive. It’s hard enough to park on this road with the amount of cars/permits/schools parking and the train station at the top of the road. If this car has been stolen & dumped outside our house it needs to be returned back to its rightful owner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44, Kimberley Drive, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mass keaves outsude house 37, 10th October
